channel.title: Rediscovering the Magic
channel.description: The Disney show that will take you on a journey through all 51 current films from Disney Feature Animation...with a little irreverence thrown in for good measure!
channel.copyright: Copyright © 2010 Rick Gutierrez. All rights reserved.
channel.itunes:keywords: Disney, Disney Animation, Disney movies, Feature Animation,
channel.itunes:summary: The Disney show that will take you on a journey through all 51 current films from Disney Feature Animation...with a little irreverence thrown in for good measure!

item.title: Rediscovering the Magic Episode 33: Toy Story 2 and Monsters Inc.!
item.dc:creator: amazingcomicast
item.description:
To all who come to this happy podcast, welcome. Rediscovering the Magic is your podcast. Here, geeks relive fond memories of the past…and here those with youthful minds may enjoy and laugh at the promise of poop jokes. Rediscovering the Magic is dedicated to the ideals, the dreams, and the hard facts that have created Disney, with the hope that it will be a source of joy and entertainment to all the world.

We bring you our third episode all about Pixar!  This episode we are joined by John Colwell from the Extremely Loud and Incredibly Nerdy podcast as we talk about all that is Toy Story 2 and Monsters Inc.  Enjoy, and join us next month when we talk about Finding Nemo and The Incredibles!

We bring you our third episode all about Pixar!  This episode we are joined by John Colwell from the Extremely Loud and Incredibly Nerdy podcast as we talk about all that is Toy Story 2 and Monsters Inc.  Enjoy, and join us next month when we talk about Finding Nemo and The Incredibles!

item.title: Rediscovering the Magic Episode 32: Toy Story and A Bug’s Life!
item.dc:creator: amazingcomicast
item.description:
To all who come to this happy podcast, welcome. Rediscovering the Magic is your podcast. Here, geeks relive fond memories of the past…and here those with youthful minds may enjoy and laugh at the promise of poop jokes. Rediscovering the Magic is dedicated to the ideals, the dreams, and the hard facts that have created Disney, with the hope that it will be a source of joy and entertainment to all the world.

We bring you our continuing look at Pixar with the first of the feature films.  We talk about Toy Story and A Bug’s Life and all that is these two films.  It was a fun show to record.  We hope you have as much fun listening to it as we did recording it.  Enjoy and thanks for listening!

item.title: Rediscovering the Magic Episode 31: Pixar Original Shorts
item.dc:creator: amazingcomicast
item.description:
To all who come to this happy podcast, welcome. Rediscovering the Magic is your podcast. Here, geeks relive fond memories of the past…and here those with youthful minds may enjoy and laugh at the promise of poop jokes. Rediscovering the Magic is dedicated to the ideals, the dreams, and the hard facts that have created Disney, with the hope that it will be a source of joy and entertainment to all the world.

We bring you part one of our look at all that is Pixar!  We discuss the original Pixar shorts not based on any of their movies.  We also get caught up on some of the news from Disney and we also touch briefly on the independent film Escape From Tomorrow.  Enjoy and thanks for listening!

item.title: Rediscovering the Magic Episode 30: The Films of Rankin Bass
item.dc:creator: amazingcomicast
item.description:
To all who come to this happy podcast, welcome. Rediscovering the Magic is your podcast. Here,
geeks relive fond memories of the past…and here those with youthful minds may enjoy and laugh at the promise of poop jokes. Rediscovering the Magic is dedicated to the ideals, the dreams, and the hard facts that have created Disney, with the hope that it will be a source of joy and entertainment to all the world.

(The next paragraph has a secret message!  Here’s a hint.  Every letter starting a sentence!  Happy April Fool’s Day!)

This is our 30th episode!  How about that?  I cannot believe that we have hit 30 episodes in what was originally goi [...]
item.content:encoded:
To all who come to this happy podcast, welcome. Rediscovering the Magic is your podcast. Here,
geeks relive fond memories of the past…and here those with youthful minds may enjoy and laugh at the promise of poop jokes. Rediscovering the Magic is dedicated to the ideals, the dreams, and the hard facts that have created Disney, with the hope that it will be a source of joy and entertainment to all the world.

(The next paragraph has a secret message!  Here’s a hint.  Every letter starting a sentence!  Happy April Fool’s Day!)

This is our 30th episode!  How about that?  I cannot believe that we have hit 30 episodes in what was originally going to be a 10 episode run!  So with that said, we are thrilled to bring you this really fun episode where we start our look at all things from that other studio that has made a string of hits including a movie about bugs! Everything has been leading up to this series thus far.  Please enjoy the fruits of our labor here.  I am most thankful for my co-hosts over the past 30 episodes. So with that said let’s get on with the show.  On second thought, let’s not.  Definitely not yet at least.  Even we are excited about this episode; as we should be. I for one, simply cannot contain my excitement about how fun this episode was to record.  Should always be like that to be honest.  Add the fact that the guys were as well and you have a great show.  Because of this, we cannot contain our excitement. Otherwise, it just would not be a fun show, which it is.  Underneath everything though is our love for the subject matter and of course our listeners. They, as in you guys, are our lifeblood.   Don’t think we have forgotten about you guys.  Really.  Each one of you guys can be described with one word.  Awesome.  Many a podcast has been ended because of a lack of listeners but not this one.  With that said, let’s get on with the show.  Or we can go on with this description.  Rick has already continued with this madness once before, he can do it again.  Kiss this show description goodbye.  Start listening to the episode already!
item.itunes:subtitle: To all who come to this happy podcast, welcome. Rediscovering the Magic is your podcast. Here,geeks relive fond memories of the past...and here those with ...

So with that said, we are thrilled to bring you this really fun episode where we start our look at all things from that other studio that has made a string of hits including a movie about bugs! Everything has been leading up to this series thus far. Please enjoy the fruits of our labor here. I am most thankful for my co-hosts over the past 30 episodes. So with that said let's get on with the show. On second thought, let's not. Definitely not yet at least. Even we are excited about this episode; as we should be. I for one, simply cannot contain my excitement about how fun this episode was to record. Should always be like that to be honest. Add the fact that the guys were as well and you have a great show. Because of this, we cannot contain our excitement. Otherwise, it just would not be a fun show, which it is. Underneath everything though is our love for the subject matter and of course our listeners. They, as in you guys, are our lifeblood. Don't think we have forgotten about you guys. Really. Each one of you guys can be described with one word. Awesome. Many a podcast has been ended because of a lack of listeners but not this one. With that said, let's get on with the show. Or we can go on with this description. Rick has already continued with this madness once before, he can do it again. Kiss this show description goodbye. Start listening to the episode already!

item.title: Rediscovering the Magic Episode 29: The Works of Miyazaki Concluded and Rick and Roy At All-Con!
item.dc:creator: amazingcomicast
item.description:
To all who come to this happy podcast, welcome. Rediscovering the Magic is your podcast. Here, 
geeks relive fond memories of the past…and here those with youthful minds may enjoy and laugh at the promise of poop jokes. Rediscovering the Magic is dedicated to the ideals, the dreams, and the hard facts that have created Disney, with the hope that it will be a source of joy and entertainment to all the world.

In this 29th episode of Rediscovering the Magic, we conclude our two part series about the works of the legendary Japanese animator, Hayao Miyazaki.  We talk about Princess Mononoke, Spirited Away, Howl’s Moving Castle, Ponyo, and The Wind Rises.  We also take a listen at Rick and Roy’s panel that they did at All-Con 2014 called “Disney Anonymou [...]
item.content:encoded:
To all who come to this happy podcast, welcome. Rediscovering the Magic is your podcast. Here, 
geeks relive fond memories of the past…and here those with youthful minds may enjoy and laugh at the promise of poop jokes. Rediscovering the Magic is dedicated to the ideals, the dreams, and the hard facts that have created Disney, with the hope that it will be a source of joy and entertainment to all the world.

In this 29th episode of Rediscovering the Magic, we conclude our two part series about the works of the legendary Japanese animator, Hayao Miyazaki.  We talk about Princess Mononoke, Spirited Away, Howl’s Moving Castle, Ponyo, and The Wind Rises.  We also take a listen at Rick and Roy’s panel that they did at All-Con 2014 called “Disney Anonymouse”!   This is a long episode.  Next episode, we bring you a look at that one movie studio that has quite a few hits under its belt.  Including a movie about bugs.  Thanks for listening!  Enjoy!

We talk about Princess Mononoke, Spirited Away, Howl's Moving Castle, Ponyo, and The Wind Rises. We also take a listen at Rick and Roy's panel that they did at All-Con 2014 called "Disney Anonymouse"! This is a long episode. Next episode, we bring you a look at that one movie studio that has quite a few hits under its belt. Including a movie about bugs. Thanks for listening! Enjoy!

item.title: Rediscovering the Magic Episode 28: The Works of Miiyazaki Part 1…Castle of Cagliostro to Porco Rosso
item.dc:creator: amazingcomicast
item.description:
To all who come to this happy podcast, welcome. Rediscovering the Magic is your podcast. Here, geeks relive fond memories of the past…and here those with youthful minds may enjoy and laugh at the promise of poop jokes. Rediscovering the Magic is dedicated to the ideals, the dreams, and the hard facts that have created Disney, with the hope that it will be a source of joy and entertainment to all the world.


In this 28th episode of Rediscovering the Magic, we begin a two part series about the works of the legendary Japanese animator, Hayao Miyazaki.  We discuss his films Castle of Cagliostro, Nausicaa of the Valley of the Wind, Castle in the Sky, My Neighbor Totoro, Kiki’s Delivery Sevice, and Porco Rosso!  We also take a moment to talk about Grave of the Fireflies, another film from Miyazaki’s Studio Ghibli. &nb [...]
item.content:encoded:
To all who come to this happy podcast, welcome. Rediscovering the Magic is your podcast. Here, geeks relive fond memories of the past…and here those with youthful minds may enjoy and laugh at the promise of poop jokes. Rediscovering the Magic is dedicated to the ideals, the dreams, and the hard facts that have created Disney, with the hope that it will be a source of joy and entertainment to all the world.


In this 28th episode of Rediscovering the Magic, we begin a two part series about the works of the legendary Japanese animator, Hayao Miyazaki.  We discuss his films Castle of Cagliostro, Nausicaa of the Valley of the Wind, Castle in the Sky, My Neighbor Totoro, Kiki’s Delivery Sevice, and Porco Rosso!  We also take a moment to talk about Grave of the Fireflies, another film from Miyazaki’s Studio Ghibli.  Join us next month as we  finish our series on the works of Miyazaki!
item.itunes:subtitle: To all who come to this happy podcast, welcome. Rediscovering the Magic is your podcast. Here, geeks relive fond memories of the past...and here those ...
item.itunes:summary: To all who come to this happy podcast, welcome. Rediscovering the Magic is your podcast. Here, geeks relive fond memories of the past...and here those with youthful minds may enjoy and laugh at the promise of poop jokes. Rediscovering the Magic is dedicated to the ideals, the dreams, and the hard facts that have created Disney, with the hope that it will be a source of joy and entertainment to all the world.In this 28th episode of Rediscovering the Magic, we begin a two part series about the works of the legendary Japanese animator, Hayao Miyazaki. We discuss his films Castle of Cagliostro, Nausicaa of the Valley of the Wind, Castle in the Sky, My Neighbor Totoro, Kiki's Delivery Sevice, and Porco Rosso! We also take a moment to talk about Grave of the Fireflies, another film from Miyazaki's Studio Ghibli. Join us next month as we finish our series on the works of Miyazaki!

item.title: Rediscovering the Magic Episode 27: Saving Mr.Banks and Frozen
item.dc:creator: amazingcomicast
item.description:
To all who come to this happy podcast, welcome. Rediscovering the Magic is your podcast. Here, geeks relive fond memories of the past…and here those with youthful minds may enjoy and laugh at the promise of poop jokes. Rediscovering the Magic is dedicated to the ideals, the dreams, and the hard facts that have created Disney, with the hope that it will be a source of joy and entertainment to all the world.  


In our 27th episode, Rick, Roy and Ben are together for the first time in the same room as they get together for their discussion about Saving Mr. Banks and Frozen.  Which movie was liked?  Which movie was loathed?  Listen to find out!  This is our final episode of 2013.  We’ll see you in 2014 when we start up a new run of shows and lead up to something BIG for 2014!  Thanks for listening!

item.title: Rediscovering the Magic Episode 26: Our Disney Bucket List
item.dc:creator: amazingcomicast
item.description:
To all who come to this happy podcast, welcome. Rediscovering the Magic is your podcast. Here, geeks relive fond memories of the past…and here those with youthful minds may enjoy and laugh at the promise of poop jokes. Rediscovering the Magic is dedicated to the ideals, the dreams, and the hard facts that have created Disney, with the hope that it will be a source of joy and entertainment to all the world. 


In our 26th episode, we bring you our Disney Bucket List.  Basically everything from Disney that we want to do before we kick the proverbial bucket.  We run the gamut from reasonable to expensive to just simply insane.  We also pay tribute to Disney Alumni Paul Walker from “Meet the Deedles” (!) and we also give some love to the Skippers from the Jungle Cruise.  Thanks for listening and see yo [...]
item.content:encoded:
To all who come to this happy podcast, welcome. Rediscovering the Magic is your podcast. Here, geeks relive fond memories of the past…and here those with youthful minds may enjoy and laugh at the promise of poop jokes. Rediscovering the Magic is dedicated to the ideals, the dreams, and the hard facts that have created Disney, with the hope that it will be a source of joy and entertainment to all the world. 


In our 26th episode, we bring you our Disney Bucket List.  Basically everything from Disney that we want to do before we kick the proverbial bucket.  We run the gamut from reasonable to expensive to just simply insane.  We also pay tribute to Disney Alumni Paul Walker from “Meet the Deedles” (!) and we also give some love to the Skippers from the Jungle Cruise.  Thanks for listening and see you later this month when we review FROZEN!
item.itunes:subtitle: To all who come to this happy podcast, welcome. Rediscovering the Magic is your podcast. Here, geeks relive fond memories of the past...and here those ...
item.itunes:summary: To all who come to this happy podcast, welcome. Rediscovering the Magic is your podcast. Here, geeks relive fond memories of the past...and here those with youthful minds may enjoy and laugh at the promise of poop jokes. Rediscovering the Magic is dedicated to the ideals, the dreams, and the hard facts that have created Disney, with the hope that it will be a source of joy and entertainment to all the world.In our 26th episode, we bring you our Disney Bucket List. Basically everything from Disney that we want to do before we kick the proverbial bucket. We run the gamut from reasonable to expensive to just simply insane. We also pay tribute to Disney Alumni Paul Walker from "Meet the Deedles" (!) and we also give some love to the Skippers from the Jungle Cruise. Thanks for listening and see you later this month when we review FROZEN!

item.title: Rediscovering the Magic Episode 25: The Disney Afternoon Part 3……GARGOYLES
item.dc:creator: amazingcomicast
item.description:
To all who come to this happy podcast, welcome. Rediscovering the Magic is your podcast. Here, geeks relive fond memories of the past…and here those with youthful minds may enjoy and laugh at the promise of poop jokes. Rediscovering the Magic is dedicated to the ideals, the dreams, and the hard facts that have created Disney, with the hope that it will be a source of joy and entertainment to all the world.  


In our 25th episode, we bring you the final chapter in our series about the Disney Afternoon!  We are joined by our friends Ace and Jenn as we discuss the much beloved Disney Afternoon series Gargoyles! We get a little saucy in this episode so consider this our first PG-13 episode!  Enjoy and see you again later this month for our Year in Review episode!

item.title: October Contest Prize winner Announcement!
item.dc:creator: amazingcomicast
item.description: Hey Geeketeers, Rick here with a special quick announcement about who won the October Disney Villain contest!  What to find out who it was?  Give this a listen!   The answer is quite surprising and original!  Enjoy and stay tuned for our latest episode which should be out post haste!
item.content:encoded: Hey Geeketeers, Rick here with a special quick announcement about who won the October Disney Villain contest!  What to find out who it was?  Give this a listen!   The answer is quite surprising and original!  Enjoy and stay tuned for our latest episode which should be out post haste!

The answer is quite surprising and original! Enjoy and stay tuned for our latest episode which should be out post haste!

item.title: Rediscovering the Magic Episode 24: The Disney Afternoon Part 2 (Not Gargoyles)
item.dc:creator: amazingcomicast
item.description:
To all who come to this happy podcast, welcome!  Rediscovering the Magic is your podcast.  Here we 
discuss in our 24th episode, Rick’s experience at the 2013 D23 Expo as well as the second part of our look at the awesomeness that was The Disney Afternoon! (Just not Gargoyles and there is a reason for that!)  We also take a look at some of the latest video game releases based on Disney properties.  Thanks for listening and join us next month where we discuss a most appropriate topic just in time for Halloween!

item.title: Rediscovering the Magic Episode 23: The Disney Afternoon Part 1!
item.dc:creator: amazingcomicast
item.description:
To all who come to this happy podcast, welcome!  Rediscovering the Magic is your podcast.  Here we

discuss in our 23rd episode, Roy’s visit to the Walt Disney Family Museum in San Francisco as well as the first part of our look at the awesomeness that was The Disney Afternoon!  This kicks off a two part series on the popular cartoon line up so grab a seat, buckle in, and get ready for a fun ride!  Enjoy!
item.content:encoded:
To all who come to this happy podcast, welcome!  Rediscovering the Magic is your podcast.  Here we

discuss in our 23rd episode, Roy’s visit to the Walt Disney Family Museum in San Francisco as well as the first part of our look at the awesomeness that was The Disney Afternoon!  This kicks off a two part series on the popular cartoon line up so grab a seat, buckle in, and get ready for a fun ride!  Enjoy!
item.itunes:subtitle: To all who come to this happy podcast, welcome! Rediscovering the Magic is your podcast. Here wediscuss in our 23rd episode, Roy's visit to the ...
item.itunes:summary: To all who come to this happy podcast, welcome! Rediscovering the Magic is your podcast. Here wediscuss in our 23rd episode, Roy's visit to the Walt Disney Family Museum in San Francisco as well as the first part of our look at the awesomeness that was The Disney Afternoon! This kicks off a two part series on the popular cartoon line up so grab a seat, buckle in, and get ready for a fun ride! Enjoy!

media:content.media:title: Rediscovering the Magic Episode 23: The Disney Afternoon Part 1!

item.title: Rediscovering the Magic Episode 22: Disney Backseat Superheroes!
item.dc:creator: amazingcomicast
item.description: Welcome to our 22nd episode of Rediscovering the Magic.  We gotta ask….Condorman, Dick Tracy, The Rocketeer, Will Stronghold, and John Carter.  What do these characters all have in common? These characters are either original superheroes or they are based on a comic book, comic strip, or pulp novel and they have been oft overlooked except for those who appreciate a good movie.  Well…except maybe Condorman but hey, we all slip up sometimes.  That being said, here is out 22nd episode in which we discuss the superhero/comic/pulp films from Disney before Marvel Films finally began getting released by Disney starting with Avengers.  It’s a fun talk to be sure but who better to talk about John Carter than Cole Houston who is extremely well versed in the works of Edgar Rice Burroughs to join us later in the proceedings?  Also, his wife, Mrs. JediCole jumps in on the conversation as well!  Enjoy this episode and join us next time for our look at the Disney Afternoo [...]
item.content:encoded: Welcome to our 22nd episode of Rediscovering the Magic.  We gotta ask….Condorman, Dick Tracy, The Rocketeer, Will Stronghold, and John Carter.  What do these characters all have in common? These characters are either original superheroes or they are based on a comic book, comic strip, or pulp novel and they have been oft overlooked except for those who appreciate a good movie.  Well…except maybe Condorman but hey, we all slip up sometimes.  That being said, here is out 22nd episode in which we discuss the superhero/comic/pulp films from Disney before Marvel Films finally began getting released by Disney starting with Avengers.  It’s a fun talk to be sure but who better to talk about John Carter than Cole Houston who is extremely well versed in the works of Edgar Rice Burroughs to join us later in the proceedings?  Also, his wife, Mrs. JediCole jumps in on the conversation as well!  Enjoy this episode and join us next time for our look at the Disney Afternoon!  Thanks for listening!
item.itunes:subtitle: Welcome to our 22nd episode of Rediscovering the Magic. We gotta ask....Condorman, Dick Tracy, The Rocketeer, Will Stronghold, and John Carter. What do these characters ...
item.itunes:summary: Welcome to our 22nd episode of Rediscovering the Magic. We gotta ask....Condorman, Dick Tracy, The Rocketeer, Will Stronghold, and John Carter. What do these characters all have in common? These characters are either original superheroes or they are based on a comic book, comic strip, or pulp novel and they have been oft overlooked except for those who appreciate a good movie. Well...except maybe Condorman but hey, we all slip up sometimes. That being said, here is out 22nd episode in which we discuss the superhero/comic/pulp films from Disney before Marvel Films finally began getting released by Disney starting with Avengers. It's a fun talk to be sure but who better to talk about John Carter than Cole Houston who is extremely well versed in the works of Edgar Rice Burroughs to join us later in the proceedings? Also, his wife, Mrs. JediCole jumps in on the conversation as well! Enjoy this episode and join us next time for our look at the Disney Afternoon! Thanks for listening!

item.title: Rediscovering the Magic Episode 21: Who Framed Roger Rabbit?
item.dc:creator: amazingcomicast
item.description: Welcome to our 21st episode of Rediscovering the Magic, our continuing look at Disney History, Trivia, and Poop Jokes.   We bring you our 21st episode which is also our final look at all that is Live Action and Animation with one of the most critically acclaimed movies of all time with Who Framed Roger Rabbit!  We are joined by our friends Tim Grassey of WDW Theme Parks and formerly of the WDW Fan Boys Podcast, and Jim Hill of Jim Hill Media.  Jim dishes on all things Roger Rabbit and then also dishes on a bunch of upcoming stuff for Disney as well!   Thanks for listening!
item.content:encoded: Welcome to our 21st episode of Rediscovering the Magic, our continuing look at Disney History, Trivia, and Poop Jokes.   We bring you our 21st episode which is also our final look at all that is Live Action and Animation with one of the most critically acclaimed movies of all time with Who Framed Roger Rabbit!  We are joined by our friends Tim Grassey of WDW Theme Parks and formerly of the WDW Fan Boys Podcast, and Jim Hill of Jim Hill Media.  Jim dishes on all things Roger Rabbit and then also dishes on a bunch of upcoming stuff for Disney as well!   Thanks for listening!

item.itunes:summary: Welcome to our 21st episode of Rediscovering the Magic, our continuing look at Disney History, Trivia, and Poop Jokes. We bring you our 21st episode which is also our final look at all that is Live Action and Animation with one of the most critically acclaimed movies of all time with Who Framed Roger Rabbit! We are joined by our friends Tim Grassey of WDW Theme Parks and formerly of the WDW Fan Boys Podcast, and Jim Hill of Jim Hill Media. Jim dishes on all things Roger Rabbit and then also dishes on a bunch of upcoming stuff for Disney as well! Thanks for listening!

item.title: Rediscovering the Magic Episode 20: Bedknobs and Broomsticks and Pete’s Dragon
item.dc:creator: amazingcomicast
item.description: Welcome to our 20th episode of Rediscovering the Magic, our look at Disney History, Trivia, and Poop Jokes.  In this penultimate episode of our look at the movies that combine live action and animation, we discuss Angela Lansbury and David Tomlinson kicking all kinds of butt in Bedknobs and Broomsticks, and then we jump into Shelley Winters and Jim Dale (!) territory with Pete’s Dragon.  Our buddy Cole Houston of the JediCole Universe and United States of Geekdom jumps in at the final bit to bring some additional craziness to the proceedings.   We also announce the name of our Twitter feed!  Enjoy and thanks for listening!
item.content:encoded: Welcome to our 20th episode of Rediscovering the Magic, our look at Disney History, Trivia, and Poop Jokes.  In this penultimate episode of our look at the movies that combine live action and animation, we discuss Angela Lansbury and David Tomlinson kicking all kinds of butt in Bedknobs and Broomsticks, and then we jump into Shelley Winters and Jim Dale (!) territory with Pete’s Dragon.  Our buddy Cole Houston of the JediCole Universe and United States of Geekdom jumps in at the final bit to bring some additional craziness to the proceedings.   We also announce the name of our Twitter feed!  Enjoy and thanks for listening!

item.itunes:summary: Welcome to our 20th episode of Rediscovering the Magic, our look at Disney History, Trivia, and Poop Jokes. In this penultimate episode of our look at the movies that combine live action and animation, we discuss Angela Lansbury and David Tomlinson kicking all kinds of butt in Bedknobs and Broomsticks, and then we jump into Shelley Winters and Jim Dale (!) territory with Pete's Dragon. Our buddy Cole Houston of the JediCole Universe and United States of Geekdom jumps in at the final bit to bring some additional craziness to the proceedings. We also announce the name of our Twitter feed! Enjoy and thanks for listening!

item.title: Rediscovering the Magic Episode 19: Mary Poppins!
item.dc:creator: amazingcomicast
item.description: Welcome to our 19th episode of Rediscovering the Magic, our continuing look at the films from Disney that combine live action and animation.   We bring you our look at what is arguably one of the greatest movies of all time, of Mary Poppins!  We also talk about the creative genius of the Sherman Brothers and their music.  Enjoy and thanks for listening!
item.content:encoded: Welcome to our 19th episode of Rediscovering the Magic, our continuing look at the films from Disney that combine live action and animation.   We bring you our look at what is arguably one of the greatest movies of all time, of Mary Poppins!  We also talk about the creative genius of the Sherman Brothers and their music.  Enjoy and thanks for listening!
item.itunes:subtitle: Welcome to our 19th episode of Rediscovering the Magic, our continuing look at the films from Disney that combine live action and animation. We ...
item.itunes:summary: Welcome to our 19th episode of Rediscovering the Magic, our continuing look at the films from Disney that combine live action and animation. We bring you our look at what is arguably one of the greatest movies of all time, of Mary Poppins! We also talk about the creative genius of the Sherman Brothers and their music. Enjoy and thanks for listening!

item.title: Rediscovering the Magic Episode 18: Song of the South and So Dear to my Heart….Strike that….
item.dc:creator: amazingcomicast
item.description:
Welcome to Rediscovering the Magic, our ongoing series of Disney trivia, history, and poop jokes.  We bring you our 18th episode where we continue our series on the films that combine live action and animation with one movie that is very obscure while the other one is not exactly available for purchase in the United States but is much beloved regardless. “So Dear to My Heart” is an obscure classic that displays the medium in a very sweet and fun movie.  ”Song of the South” could possibly be one of the most misunderstood movies of all time.  Both star child actor Bobby Driscoll and both are worth your time….if you can find them.  Enjoy and thanks for listening!

CONTEST ALERT!  We need a Twitter feed name!  Come up with one and e-mail us at geeketeersunite@gmail.com and we will pick our favorite.  If you aren’t careful, you might even win something cool!

item.title: Rediscovering the Magic Episode 17: Thhe Reluctant Dragon and Victory Through Air Power!
item.dc:creator: amazingcomicast
item.description: Welcome to this 17th episode of Rediscovering the Magic!  We bring you this episode where Rick, Roy, and Ben take a look at the two earliest movies that combined live action and animation, The Reluctant Dragon and the World War II propaganda film Viictory Through Air Power.  We also take a look at some of the more memorable (and infamous) bits of propaganda from that era as well.  Next episode we will take a look at Song of the South and So Dear to My Heart!    Thanks for listening and enjoy the episode!
item.content:encoded: Welcome to this 17th episode of Rediscovering the Magic!  We bring you this episode where Rick, Roy, and Ben take a look at the two earliest movies that combined live action and animation, The Reluctant Dragon and the World War II propaganda film Viictory Through Air Power.  We also take a look at some of the more memorable (and infamous) bits of propaganda from that era as well.  Next episode we will take a look at Song of the South and So Dear to My Heart!    Thanks for listening and enjoy the episode!

Thanks for listening and enjoy the episode!

item.title: Rediscovering the Magic Episode 16: Disney and Christmas!
item.dc:creator: amazingcomicast
item.description: Welcome to Rediscovering the Magic!  Your monthly dose of Disney history, trivia, and poop jokes.  Christmas time, there is snow on the ground (in some parts of the world) and there are TONS of Christmas specials to watch!  Rick, Roy, and Ben bring you this, their favorites that are from Disney and some that are not as well known!  Enjoy, thanks for the download and join us next month where we kick off our series on the films that combine live action and animation!  Merry Christmas!

item.title: Rediscovering the Magic Episode 15: Tron to Wreck-It Ralph (and Paperman in the middle!)
item.dc:creator: amazingcomicast
item.description: Welcome to this 15th episode of Rediscovering the Magic where we are at first joined by Cole Houston of the United States of Geekdom and the JediCole Universe and we talk about the recent Lucasfilm acquisition by Disney!  Then, we get into Disney movies about video games.  Starting with Tron and ending with Wreck-It Ralph we talk about the good, the bad, and the garbage.  Also, Paperman gets some much deserved love as well!  Enjoy and thanks for listening!
